name: APL Volumes Podcast
description:
Welcome to Season 2 of APL Volumes! Hosted by Leticia Leal, a Teen Program Specialist at APL, this is our “everything but the books” season. Each episode dives into a part of our collection that you may not know about: Zines, LPs, board games, plant seeds and more. This season begins on Wednesday, September 27th. New episodes come out every other week! 

You can listen and subscribe on itunes, spotify, iheartradio, or online.

description: Pollinator Week is an annual celebration in support of pollinator health. Austin Public Library celebrates this week with programs and activities dedicated to increasing community knowledge and adopting pollinator friendly practices.

name: Holistic Wellness Program with the MACC
summary: Workshops and classes designed to promote holistic wellness for adults in our community.
description: In partnership with the Emma S. Barrientos - Mexican American Cultural Center the Austin Public Library is hosting a series of free workshops and classes designed to promote holistic wellness for adults in our community.

name: Pride
summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.

name: El día de los niños/El día de los libros
subtitle: (Children's Day/Book Day)
summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
description:
El día de los niños/El día de los libros (Children's Day/Book Day), commonly known as Día, is a celebration every day of children, families, and reading that culminates yearly on April 30. The celebration emphasizes the importance of literacy for children of all linguistic and cultural backgrounds.

Día is a nationally recognized initiative that emphasizes the importance of literacy for all children from all backgrounds. It is a daily commitment to linking children and their families to diverse books, languages and cultures. The common goals of all Día programming are to:

  • Celebrate children and connect them to the world of learning through books, stories and libraries.
  • Nurture cognitive and literacy development in ways that honor and embrace a child’s home language and culture.
  • Introduce families to community resources that provide opportunities for learning through multiple literacies.
  • Recognize and respect culture, heritage and language as powerful tools for strengthening families and communities.

name: Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander Heritage Month
summary: Austin Public Library is proud to celebrate Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander (AANHPI) Heritage Month, also known as Asian American Pacific Islander Heritage Month (AAPI). Observed annually in May, AANHPI Heritage Month is a time to reflect upon and celebrate the remarkable role of the AANHPI community in our nation’s history.
description: Austin Public Library is proud to celebrate Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander (AANHPI) Heritage Month, also known as Asian American Pacific Islander Heritage Month (AAPI). Observed annually in May, AANHPI Heritage Month is a time to reflect upon and celebrate the remarkable role of the AANHPI community in our nation’s history.

name: APL Innovate
summary: APL Innovate is Austin Public Library’s digital makerspace for collaboration and creation. We are providing community access to state-of-the-art computer hardware and software to create digital content such as podcasts, videos, 3D renderings, music, and more. Visit our makerspace page for complete information. We hope you’ll join us for a digital makerspace event at the library. After you visit, tell us what you #MadeAtAPL!
description: APL Innovate is Austin Public Library’s digital makerspace for collaboration and creation. We are providing community access to state-of-the-art computer hardware and software to create digital content such as podcasts, videos, 3D renderings, music, and more. name: Central Library Art Tour
summary: Take a staff-guided tour of the Austin Public Library's Central building with a specific focus on the art situated throughout five floors.
description: Take a staff-guided tour of the Austin Public Library's Central building with a specific focus on the art situated throughout five floors.

name: Dinovember
summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
description: Celebrate Dinosaurs all November long, all across APL branches! Dinovember programs will have hands-on science activities, Cretaceous crafts, pop-up museums, special guests, and more! Check out upcoming events below.

name: Women's History Month
subtitle: Celebrating the accomplishments of women
summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
description: In the month of March, APL will be celebrating the efforts and accomplishments of women around the world. Join us at one of our many events!

name: Teddy Bear
summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
description: Bring your teddy along for a very special storytime with bear-themed stories, songs, crafts, activities, and play.

name: Roots & Wings Festival
summary: The Roots & Wings Festival is Austin’s annual celebration of Arbor Day and Monarch Appreciation Day. It is a community—wide celebration of trees, butterflies, bees and nature in our city.
description: The Roots & Wings Festival is Austin’s annual celebration of Arbor Day and Monarch Appreciation Day. It is a community—wide celebration of trees, butterflies, bees and nature in our city.

name: Miyazaki Fest
summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.

name: Books & Breweries
subtitle: Every month a different book/brewery
summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
description: Join us each month to explore a different local Brewery and a book that goes well with beer. From cult novels to contemporary nonfiction; from stouts to sours and everything in between.

name: Adult Story Hour
description: Tell a five minute story – truth, fiction, funny, serious, read or memorized, any story about life, fantasy or yourself. New themes each time!

name: APL Volumes
description:
Welcome to the home for the new, revamped APL Volumes podcast! This season, we dig up the history of the horror genre with our host, librarian Maddy Newquist.  APL Volumes is recorded and edited in our Innovation Lab, located in the 5th floor Digital Makerspace of our Central location(710 W. Cesar Chavez). 

Click below to listen on any of these platforms:

name: Art Reception
description: Art reception and show.

name: Art Smart
description: Love Art? Let’s be Art Smart and explore different ethnic arts, art media, and techniques at this weekly family art experience for all ages and generations.

name: ASL Interpreter Provided
description:
An ASL interpreter will be provided for these programs.

The City of Austin is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act. Reasonable modifications and equal access to communications will be provided upon request. For assistance please call 512-974-7449.

name: Black History Month
description:
Celebrate Black History Month at Austin Public Library.

Check out the special exhibits celebrating Black History Month here.

name: Board with Books
description:
Do you love playing board games? Then come to Board with Books!

¿Le encantan los juegos de mesa? ¡Venga a Board with Books!

A wide range of modern and traditional board games are available to play. Come and learn something new or bring a personal favorite and teach someone else how to play!

Ofrecemos una gran variedad de juegos de mesas – ambos modernos y tradicionales – para su gusto. ¡Venga a jugar y aprenda algo nuevo o traiga un juego favorito y enseñe cómo jugar a otra persona!

name: Camp Bluebonnet
description: We’re Celebrating the Texas Bluebonnet Award by reading books from this year’s list! Remember you’ve got to read 5 to decide and after attending these programs you’ll be well on your way to be qualified to vote next school year! Join us to enjoy a variety of books and related activities.

name: College Planning Workshops
description: Join Access College America's Dale Price, MBA for a free college planning workshop series. This series of 4 programs is designed for an information packed hour to help you learn how to best assist your child while navigating through the college admission process like a pro.

name: Cuentos en español
description: Una hora de cuentos en español para niños y niñas desde bebitos hasta edad escolar.

name: Día de los Muertos
description:
A day of fun and laughter, and remembering our loved ones passed. Learn about this traditional holiday with this fun, engaging, cultural program through stories, music, shadow show puppetry, and arts and crafts.

Un día de risas y diversión y de recordar a nuestros queridos muertitos. Aprende sobre este día tradicional con este divertido y encantador programa cultural, por medio de cuentos, música, teatro de sombras y manualidades.

name: Eat the World
description: Join us as we experience the richness of global cultures through regional cuisine! In addition to being able to taste the food, guests will be taught how to prepare the dishes at home. Our cooks will provide step-by-step instructions and point guests to local shops for hard-to-find ingredients.

name: Español
description:
• programas y recursos en varios idiomas
    • inglés
    • español
    • formato bilingüe
  • eventos
  • actividades
  • clases
  • gratuitas

  • nuestra página en español: library.austintexas.gov/es

name: Hispanic Latino Heritage Month
description:
Austin Public Library celebrates Hispanic Heritage Month with rich cultural experiences that enlighten and empower our community.

La Biblioteca Pública de Austin celebra el Mes de la Hispanidad con ricas experiencias culturales que iluminan y fortalecen a nuestra comunidad.

name: Mayor's Book Club
description: The Mayor's Book Club is an annual citywide reading campaign to encourage a community experience through reading, discussion, and exploration of shared books. The Mayor's Book Club is presented by the Library Foundation in partnership with the City of Austin Mayor's Office and the Austin Public Library.

name: Read Watch Talk
description: Literature purists will stand by the book. Film buffs will make a case for the movie. Either way, there is something to discuss. Take part in our movie-book club by reading on your own and/or watching with us, and then discussing the merits of each following the film.

name: Romance Book Club
description: Join us to discuss romance novels, classic romances, Young Adult romance and more!

name: Spanish
description: The Austin Public Library hosts events, and provides books, movies and music, for all ages in Spanish. All Library events are free and open to the public.

name: Trivia Night
description:
Join friends and fans for trivia fun at the Library!

With 8 rounds of 8 questions, bring a team of up to 6 members for question/answer, fill-in-the-blank, audio & video rounds.

Snacks provided.

Recommended for adults.

name: Write Club
description:
Join our creative writing group! Fuel your creativity with short-timed writing exercises using provided prompts. Inspire and be inspired by others! This program is suitable for adults.

This is not a class on how to write. No instruction is given.

name: Yoga Meditation Classes
description: Learn how to manage stress through yoga and guided meditation techniques.
